sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"群，帮，伙"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: group, crowd, gang, band, mob, throng, masses, swarm
means: group ： 普通用词，通常指有组织、有秩序的一群人，也可指无意汇集在一起的一群人。
crowd ： 常指无组织地乱哄哄地挤在一起的人群。
gang ： 常指从事非法、暴力或敌对活动的帮派或团伙。有时呈中性，词义同group。
band ： 多指一群有明确宗旨，为共同目的而结合在一起的人，常含贬义。
mob ： 指无组织、乱七八糟凑合在一起的乌合之众，或指聚集在一起寻衅滋事的人群，多为暴徒。
throug ： 书面用词，意义接近crowd，侧重密集地挤在一起的一群，含挤在一起向前推进之意。
masses ： 指群众或人民大众。
swarm ： 指人数众多，杂乱无章，不停移动的一群人。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"乐队"之意。
means: orchestra ： 指规模大、最为完整的交响乐队，可演奏各种不同音乐，一般由弦乐、本管乐、铜管乐和打击乐所组成。
band ： 指主要由铜、木管和打击乐所组成的乐队，主要演奏轻音乐和流行乐曲，与orchestra的主区别在于没有弦乐。

word_mean: 带、束、环：束缚的部分、结构或工具
在牙科学上，一种用于水平围绕牙冠或牙根之金属薄条，称为牙环
在细胞遗传学中，为染色体的部分，在染色后由出现深或浅、亮或暗的邻近节段而能清晰鉴别，称为带，根据应用的方法称为C带、F带、G带等
见cell项下的band cells(带状细胞)
在指定的最低波长与最高波长之间的波长范围。

sentence.Network_en: My underskirt had ridden up into a thick band around my hips.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的衬裙已经蹿到臀部，厚厚地卷成一圈。

sentence.Network_en: I learned a lot from him about how to run a band.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从他那里学到了许多关于经营乐队方面的东西.

sentence.Network_en: Kurt had started out playing bass in a rock band.
sentence.Network_cn: 库尔特起初在一个摇滚乐队弹低音吉他。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English  (in sense 4), from Old Norse, reinforced in late Middle English  by Old French bande, of Germanic origin; related to bind
late Middle English : from Old French bande, of Germanic origin; related to banner

entry.def: A band is a small group of musicians who play popular music such as jazz, rock, or pop.

example.ex: He was a drummer in a rock band...
example.tran: 他曾是一个摇滚乐团的鼓手。

example.ex: Local bands provide music for dancing.
example.tran: 当地的乐队为跳舞伴乐。

entry.tran: （演奏铜管和打击乐器的）乐队，乐团
entry.def: A band is a group of musicians who play brass and percussion instruments.

example.tran: 乐队演奏了德军进行曲。

entry.def: A band of people is a group of people who have joined together because they share an interest or belief.

example.ex: Bands of government soldiers, rebels and just plain criminals have been roaming some neighborhoods.
example.tran: 成群结队的政府军士兵、反叛分子和彻头彻尾的犯罪分子一直在一些街区游荡。

example.ex: ...a small but growing band of Japanese companies taking their first steps into American publishing.
example.tran: 数量不多、但仍在增长的一批初次涉足美国出版业的日本公司

entry.def: band is a flat, narrow strip of cloth which you wear round your head or wrists, or which forms part of a piece of clothing.

example.ex: Almost all hospitals use a wrist-band of some kind with your name and details on it.
example.tran: 几乎所有的医院都用某种腕带记录名字和详细信息。

entry.def: A band is a strip of something such as colour, light, land, or cloth which contrasts with the areas on either side of it.

example.ex: ...bands of natural vegetation between strips of crops...
example.tran: 农作物狭地之间的野生植被带

example.ex: A band of light glowed in the space between floor and door.
example.tran: 一束阳光透过地板和门之间的缝隙照了进来

entry.def: A band is a strip or loop of metal or other strong material which strengthens something, or which holds several things together.

example.ex: Surgeons placed a metal band around the knee cap to help it knit back together.
example.tran: 外科医生在膝盖骨上套了个金属箍以帮助其愈合。

example.ex: ...a strong band of flat muscle tissue.
example.tran: 一圈坚韧的扁平肌肉组织

entry.def: A band is a range of numbers or values within a system of measurement.

example.ex: For an initial service, a 10 megahertz-wide band of frequencies will be needed.
example.tran: 初始服务需要10兆赫宽的频带。

example.ex: ...a new tax band of 20p in the pound on the first £2,000 of taxable income.
example.tran: 对应税收入的头两千英镑每镑征收20便士的新税阶

entry.def: If something such as a tax is banded, it is divided into bands according to the value of the thing being taxed.

example.ex: They appear to rule out some of the ideas that have been mentioned — banding the tax so higher earners would pay more.
example.tran: 他们看来要剔除其中提到的一些想法——如把税率分档，使收入越高，缴得越多。

example.ex: ...a banding system based on property values...
example.tran: 基于财产价值的分级制

means.word_mean: 1. an unofficial association of people or groups;
4. a strip or stripe of a contrasting color or material
5. a group of musicians playing popular music for dancing

7. something elongated that is worn around the body or one of the limbs
8. jewelry consisting of a circlet of precious metal (often set with jewels) worn on the finger;

means.word_mean: 9. a strip of material attached to the leg of a bird to identify it (as in studies of bird migration)
10. a restraint put around something to hold it together
1. bind or tie together, as with a band
2. attach a ring to the foot of, in order to identify;

Sentence.sentence: And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
Your rock band has never sounded better.
The rock band needs more hours of practice
The rock band is going to play here for a month.

sentences.en: The boy banded the dog's neck with a yellow string.
sentences.cn: 男孩把一条黄绳绑在狗脖子上。

means.word_mean: 给…镶边；用嵌条(或条纹)装饰

sentences.en: She banded her hat with a silk strip.

means.word_mean: 把…联合起来；使聚集成群，结成一队(或一伙)；结成联盟；团结

sentences.en: We banded ourselves together and organized a committee.
sentences.cn: 我们联合起来，组织了一个委员会。
一些家庭已经联合了起来。

means.word_mean: 聚集，联合(起来) (通常与together 连用)

sentences.en: If we band together, we can give our argument strength.
sentences.cn: 如果我们联合起来，我们能为我们的辩论增添力量。

jushi.english: It was a treasure chest with thin bands of black metal round it.
jushi.chinese: 这是一只镶有黑色金属窄边的财宝箱。

jushi.english: I could hear a jazz band playing .
jushi.chinese: 我能听见一支爵士乐队在演奏。
